drupalNodeEvent.title: Rethinking Cultural Constructions of Law in East Asia

field_speakers.processed: Mark Ramseyer, Taisu Zhang, Jisoo Kim, Teemu Ruskola, Ben Liebman, Li Chen, Sida Liu, Rachel Stern, Annelise Riles, Donald Clarke, Kentaro Matsubara

field_organizers.processed: Yale Law School; Cornell Law School; University of Toronto History Department

field_description.processed: This is a year long lecture series, taking place each month on Zoom. There are 11 speakers, each paired with 2 commentators. The topics include Japanese village ostracism, Qing fiscal institutions, adultery law in early modern Korea, Chinese Courts, legal regulation of inequality in modern Chinese history, and many others.
